alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 11:40AM PDT until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 138 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Bernardino. Including portions of the Apple and El Dorado burn scar. * WHEN...Until 138 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1139 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.20 and 0.50 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.50 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Mount San Gorgonio, Big Bear Lake, Seven Oaks, Hwy 38 Between Yucaipa And Onyx Summit, Angelus Oaks, Hwy 18 Between Running Springs And Big Bear, Barton Flats Campground and Heart Bar Campground. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
